p: We recorded eight oligolectic bee species (Fowler, 2016) in pan traps, two of which visited our experimental plants. Three females of Osmia distincta were caught on the native Penstemon laevigatus (Table S1 and Figures S1–S6). Melissodes desponsus typically forages on Cirsium plants (Fowler, 2016) which were not included in our experiment. Almost all M. desponsus recorded were males and captured exclusively on non‐native plants (i.e., on Cosmos bipinnatus (7 males, 1 female) and on Daucus carota (1 male)) (Table S1 and Figures S1–S6).
